label: ZEN74
overview: Manual or Z-Wave on/off and brightness control.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: On/Off Toggle Orientation
parameters.description: Choose if you want to turn the light on or turn the light off when you toggle up the switch.

options.label: Toggle up turns the light on, toggle down turns it off (default)
Toggle up turns the light off, toggle down turns it on
Toggle any direction to turn the light on/off (change state)

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer
parameters.description: Enable/disable the auto turn-off timer function.
parameters.overview:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn off once it has been turned on).

Values: 0 – timer disabled (default); 1 – 65535 (minutes).

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer
parameters.description: Enable/disable the auto turn-on timer function.
parameters.overview:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-on timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn on once it has been turned off).

Values: 0 – timer disabled (default); 1 – 65535 (minutes).

parameters.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.description: Set the on off status for the switch after power failure.

options.label: Forced to OFF (regardless of state prior to power outage)
Forced to ON (regardless of state prior to power outage)
Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure (default)

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control - Physical on
parameters.description: Adjust the "on" (fade-in) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated physically.
parameters.overview:
Adjust the "on" (fade-in) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated physically from the toggle. Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to reach full or max brightness.

Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). 0 – instant on. Default: 0.

parameters.label: Minimum Brightness
parameters.description: Set the minimum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer
parameters.overview:
Set the minimum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won’t be able to dim the light below the set value.

Values: 1 – 99 (%). Default: 1.

parameters.label: Maximum Brightness
parameters.description: Set the maximum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer.
parameters.overview:
Set the maximum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won’t be able to add brightness to the light beyond the set value. Note: if Parameter 12 is set to value 0, Parameter 11 is automatically disabled.

Values: 1 – 99 (%). Default: 99.

parameters.label: Double Tap Behavior
parameters.description: Choose what you'd like the dimmer to do when you double-tap the toggle up.

options.label: Light will turn on to full brightness (default)
Light will turn on to the custom brightness level set in parameter 18
Light will turn on to the maximum brightness level set in Parameter 11
Double tap disabled

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Scene Control
parameters.description: Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers.

options.label: Scene control disabled (default)
Scene control enabled

parameters.label: Smart Bulb Mode
parameters.description: Smart Bulb Mode: Enable/Disable Toggle / Z-Wave Control
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable on/off control from the toggle (aka disable the relay). If disabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available from the toggle.

For option 3:

NOTE: Hold the toggle down for 10 seconds until the LED indicator starts blinking, then within 2 seconds, toggle the switch down 5 times quickly to change this mode. The LED indicator will stay solid green for 3 seconds to confirm the change.

options.label: Physical toggle control disabled
Physical toggle control enabled (default)
Physical toggle and Z-Wave control disabled

parameters.label: Physical Dimming Speed
parameters.description: Set the physical dimming speed when pressing and holding the toggle.
parameters.overview:
Set the time it takes to get from 0% to 100% brightness when pressing and holding the toggle (physical dimming). The number entered as value corresponds to the number of seconds.

Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). Default: 5.

parameters.label: Custom Brightness Level On
parameters.description: Custom brightness level for single or double tap up
parameters.overview:
Set the custom brightness level (instead of the last set brightness level) you want the dimmer to come on to when you single tap or double tap the toggle up (see parameters 12 and 25).

Values: 0 – last brightness level (default); 1 – 99 (%) for custom brightness level.

parameters.label: Dimmer Report Type
parameters.description: Dimmer Report Type
parameters.overview:
First  option – send basic set report for each brightness level to hub when physical / Z-Wave control is disabled for physical dimming when the toggle is manually tapped/ held; report final brightness level only (basic set report) for physical dimming when the toggle is manually tapped/ held and physical / Z-Wave control is enabled; always report final brightness level only (via multilevel reports) for Z-Wave control regardless of the physical / Z-Wave control mode.

Second option – report final brightness level only for physical dimming, regardless of the physical / Z-Wave control mode.

Third option – send multilevel report for each brightness level to hub when physical / Z-Wave control is disabled for physical dimming when the toggle is manually tapped/ held; report final brightness level only (multilevel report) for physical dimming when the toggle is manually tapped/ held and physical / Z-Wave control is enabled; always report final brightness level only (via multilevel reports) for Z-Wave control regardless of the physical / Z-Wave control mode.

options.label: Send basic set report
Send final brightness level report
Send multilevel report

parameters.label: Reporting behavior for disabled physical control.
parameters.description: Set reporting behavior for disabled physical control.
parameters.overview:
First option - Switch reports on/off status and changes LED indicator state even if physical and Z-Wave control is disabled (default).

Second option – Switch doesn't report on/off status or change LED indicator state when physical (and Z-Wave) control is disabled.

options.label: Reports on/off status and changes LED
Doesn't report on/off status or change LED

parameters.label: Night Light Mode
parameters.description: Brightness level the dimmer will turn on to when off and when toggle is held DOWN.
parameters.overview:
Set the brightness level the dimmer will turn on to when off and when toggle is held DOWN for a second.

Values: 0 – feature disabled; 1 – 99 (%). Default: 20.

parameters.label: Single Tap Behavior
parameters.description: Choose what you'd like the dimmer to do when you tap the toggle up once.

options.label: Light will turn on to the last brightness level (default)
Light will turn on to the custom brightness level set in parameter 18
Light will turn on to the maximum brightness level set in Parameter 11
Light will turn on to full brightness

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Programming on the Toggle
parameters.description: Enable or disable programming functionality on the toggle (physical taps)
parameters.overview: Enable or disable programming functionality on the toggle (physical taps). If this setting is disabled, then inclusion, exclusion, smart bulb mode no longer work when dimmer is toggled in its usual sequence (factory reset and scene control will still work) - that means you can now use triple-tap triggers on the dimmer for scenes and remote control of other devices.

options.label: Programming enabled (default)
Programming disabled

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control - Physical off
parameters.description: Adjust the "off" (fade-out) ramp rate when it's operated physically.
parameters.overview:
Adjust the "off" (fade-out) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated physically from the toggle. Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to turn off from full or max brightness.

Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). 0 – instant off. Default: 2.

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control - Z-Wave on
parameters.description: Adjust the "on" (fade-in) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated via Z-Wave.
parameters.overview:
Adjust the "on" (fade-in) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated via Z-Wave from your hub. Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to reach full or max brightness.

Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). 0 – instant on. 255 – match physical ramp rate (set in parameter 9). Default: 255.

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control - Z-Wave off
parameters.description: Adjust the "off" (fade-out) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated via Z-Wave.
parameters.overview:
Adjust the "off" (fade-out) ramp rate for your dimmer when it's operated via Z-Wave from your hub. Values correspond to the number of seconds it take for the dimmer to turn off from full or max brightness.

Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). 0 – instant off. 255 – match physical ramp rate (set in parameter 27). Default: 255.

parameters.label: Remote Dimming Speed
parameters.description: Duration for multilevel commands sent to devices associated with the dimmer in Group 3.
parameters.overview:
Set the duration for multilevel commands sent to devices associated with the dimmer in Group 3 for smooth remote dimming experience.

Values: 1 – 99 (seconds). Default: 5.
